0: Tea and coffee making facilities are available in the room at no extra cost you simply have to ask room service to provide it
Arrived before the room was ready however the staff arranged for use of the Aldwych pre check in lounge which was greatly appreciated after the long flight
On our return out room had been tidied up and water for overnight put on the bedside table
We stayed one night in an Executive room 315 which was a little disapointing quite small for an Executive room and there was no in room coffee making facility
And I would count far cheaper hotel rooms in that comparison
Rooms are small for the price
The rooms are a bit small but very well appointed and the service is impeccable
Much better service and quality of room
I also noticed in the bathroom was a toiletries bag for flying
Room freezing cold could not get it to warm up
1: The room was beautiful and the bed very comfortable
The bed was very comfortable and the shower in the bathroom was wonderful
The hotel and its bedrooms are stunning
Attentive friendly helpful and efficient staff a great lobby bar innovative restaurants and a luxurious room made our stay a five star experience
The rooms were spectacular as was Indigo and the pool sublime
bathroom was large in size and closet as well
The accessible rooms were finished quite recently
The rooms are tastefully decorated with really calm colours which is a contrast from the bustling and rather busy location that it sits in
With you birthday you fully surprised with presents in your room
The lounge bar bedrooms and the Indigo restaurant are stunning and have exceeded all our expectations
